intro: Argomuellera reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate argomuellera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves with a distinctive reticulate venation pattern. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
